UI Interface¶

class epyk.interfaces.Components.Components(rptObj)¶
bespoke(htmlCls, *args, **kwargs)¶

Hook to allow the creation of bespoke component using specific configurations. Components can be self contained in a module and rely on external packages

Tip: Look at the Import.extend function in order to add external Js and CSS modules to your environment

Parameters

  • htmlCls – Class. The bespoke HTML component

  • args – The python attributes used in the HTML component contructor

  • kwargs – The python attributes used in the HTML component contructor

button = None¶

shortcut for button epyk.interfaces.components.CompButtons.Buttons.button()

property buttons¶

Group all the UI components dedicated to produce button or checkbox.

property charts¶

Group all the UI components dedicated to produce charts.

Different kind of charts framework are available (ChartJs, Plotly, C3, Billboard, NVD3, DC, Vis or even D3).

check = None¶

shortcut for check epyk.interfaces.components.CompButtons.Buttons.check()

property codes¶

Group all the UI Components dedicated to display code fragments

This will wrap the Javascript module codemirror

https://codemirror.net/doc/manual.html

col = None¶

shortcut for column epyk.interfaces.components.CompLayouts.Layouts.col()

contents(title='Contents', top=10, right=10, left=None, width=None, '%', height=None, 'px', options=None, profile=None)¶

Add a content table to the page

Parameters

  • width – Optional. A tuple with the integer for the component width and its unit

  • height – Optional. A tuple with the integer for the component height and its unit

  • profile – Optional. A flag to set the component performance storage

context_menu(records=None, width=None, '%', height=None, 'px', visible=False, options=None, profile=None)¶

Set a bespoke Context Menu on an Item. This will create a popup on the page with action. This component is generic is need to be added to a component to work

Usage:

menu = rptObj.ui.context_menu([{"text": 'text', 'event': 'alert("ok")'}])
rptObj.ui.title("Test").attach_menu(menu)
Parameters

  • records – Optional.

  • width – Optional. A tuple with the integer for the component width and its unit

  • height – Optional. A tuple with the integer for the component height and its unit

  • visible – Optional.

  • profile – Optional. A flag to set the component performance storage

css(cssAttrs)¶

Change the CSS Style of the main container in the page

div = None¶

shortcut for div epyk.interfaces.components.CompLayouts.Layouts.div()

property drops¶

Group all the UI components dedicated to drop data.

property fields¶

Group all the UI components dedicated to produce input items.

Those components are editable items which need to be updated by the user of the dashboard. This category will take into account textarea, input text…

footer = None¶

shortcut for footer epyk.interfaces.components.CompNavigation.Navigation.footer()

form(action=None, method=None, helper=None)¶

Creates an new empty form

Usage:

f = rptObj.ui.form()

Attributes:

Parameters

  • action –

  • method –

  • helper –

property forms¶

Group all the Forms components dedicated to drop data.

Documentation https://www.w3schools.com/html/html_forms.asp

property geo¶

Group all the UI components dedicated to produce Trees or selection items.

grid = None¶

shortcut for grid epyk.interfaces.components.CompLayouts.Layouts.grid()

icon = None¶

shortcut for icon epyk.interfaces.components.CompImages.Images.icon()

property icons¶

Group all the UI components dedicated to produce icon items.

This category of component will rely on the font-awesome library for the final display.

property images¶

Group all the UI components dedicated to produce image or collection of images.

img = None¶

shortcut for img epyk.interfaces.components.CompImages.Images.img()

info = None¶

shortcut for info epyk.interfaces.components.CompRich.Rich.input()

input = None¶

shortcut for input epyk.interfaces.components.CompInputs.Inputs.input()

property inputs¶

Group all the UI components dedicated to produce input items.

Those components are editable items which need to be updated by the user of the dashboard. This category will take into account textarea, input text…

property layouts¶

Group all the UI components dedicated to produce component containers.

All the items in this category are dedicated for the structure of the dashboard and they are mainly holder of other components. This will mainly rely on bootstrap for the display of the different objects in the page.

link = None¶

shortcut for link epyk.interfaces.components.CompLinks.Links.link()

property links¶

Group all the UI components dedicated to produce links to another page or website.

list = None¶

shortcut for list epyk.interfaces.components.CompLists.Lists.list()

property lists¶

Group all the UI components dedicated to produce list or selection items.

Simple list, trees or dropdown boxes will be part of this category of items

loading(text='Loading', color=None, options=None)¶

Entry point to the loading component

This component will create a

  • label component for the text

  • icon component for the loading icon

Parameters

  • text –

  • color –

  • options –

lookup = None¶

shortcut for lookup epyk.interfaces.components.CompLists.Lists.lookup()

property media¶

Group all the UI components dedicated to produce media (video and audio) items.

Plain Vanilla HTML5 components

property menus¶
property messaging¶

Group all the UI Components dedicated to display messaging services.

This category will group (chat, RSS streams, forum, bot …). Those components are interactive and they would require underlying services and databases in order to fully work

property modal¶

Group all the UI components dedicated to produce modal components.

navbar = None¶

shortcut for bar epyk.interfaces.components.CompNavigation.Navigation.bar()

property navigation¶

Group all the UI components dedicated to produce navigation components such as navigation bar, footer, banner…

property numbers¶

Group all the UI components dedicated to produce Numbers components.

The items in this category will not be editable and they will only provide nice number renderings

radio = None¶

shortcut for radio epyk.interfaces.components.CompButtons.Buttons.radio()

register(html_comp)¶

Internal function to register a HTML component based on its memory id.

Parameters

html_comp – The html component

return the html component

property rich¶

Group all the UI components dedicated to produce rich HTML Components.

This category will take into account very specific and bespoke components.

row = None¶

shortcut for row epyk.interfaces.components.CompLayouts.Layouts.row()

shortcut for select epyk.interfaces.components.CompLists.Lists.select()

Add a side Bar to the report.

https://www.w3schools.com/howto/tryit.asp?filename=tryhow_js_sidenav

Parameters

  • links –

  • color –

  • servers –

  • position –

slider = None¶

shortcut for slider epyk.interfaces.components.CompSliders.Sliders.slider()

property sliders¶

Group all the UI components dedicated to produce slider items.

Those components are interactive and can be used to filter the data on other items in the dashboard. Those components are mainly relying on Jquery and JqueryUi

table = None¶

shortcut for tabulator epyk.interfaces.components.CompTables.Tables.tabulator()

property tables¶

Group all the UI components dedicated to produce tables or pivot tables.

Different kind of tables are available in the framework (Tabulator, Datatable, PivotTable or even a bespoke implementation).

property tags¶

Group all the other tags available in HTML.

Those tags can be considered as normal HTML component, which means Js and CSS features are also available

text = None¶

shortcut for text epyk.interfaces.components.CompTexts.Texts.text()

property texts¶

Group all the UI components dedicated to produce text components.

The items in this category will not be editable and they will only provide nice text structure like paragraph, formatted text…

title = None¶

shortcut for title epyk.interfaces.components.CompTexts.Texts.title()

tree = None¶

shortcut for tree epyk.interfaces.components.CompLists.Lists.tree()

property trees¶

Group all the UI components dedicated to produce Trees or selection items.

property vignets¶

Group all the UI components dedicated to produce rich HTML Components.

This category will take into account very specific and bespoke components.

workflow(records, width=None, '%', height=40, 'px', color=None, options=None)¶

Description:

Entry point for the workflow object

Usage:

rptObj.ui.workflow([
  {"value": 'test 1', "status": 'success', 'label': 'test'},
  {"value": 'test 2', "status": 'error'},
  {"value": 'test 3', "status": 'pending'}])
Parameters

  • records – A list with the different steps defined in the workflow

  • width – Optional. A tuple with the integer for the component width and its unit

  • height – Optional. A tuple with the integer for the component height and its unit

  • color – Optional.

  • options – Optional. Specific Python options available for this component
